title: How do i sue a guy that drugged me with acid for 6 months strait and now i am $80,000 in debt from hospital bills?
question: i was living with a guy and he would put acid in my drinks everyday for about 6 months. he would cause me to go insane and i left. this was about 2 years ago and since i have had to go to the mental hospital from acid flash backs and i am now $80,000 in debt. i have debt collectors calling me. i have all my hospital bills. my credit is ruined. i am still going to therapy to get over the fear he invoked into my life. i do not want to pay for something he caused and i shouldn't have to. i have bi polar and taking acid caused me to have schizophrenia. i am just now adjusting and getting back on my feet again. please help me! i live in California now but this happened in Portland, Oregon.
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy,Credit,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Criminal charges,Civil rights
answers: I am sorry this happened to you. I advise you to file for bankruptcy in California.

I agree with the other posts. Your main concern should be with the collectibility of a judgement. If the accused is in fact insolvent, a civil action will be futile.
As far as your personal debt is concerned, a local bankruptcy attorney will be able to assist you in either possibly managing or even discharging your debt.

You would need to file a civil suit against the individual who had been drugging you. However, you should contact an Attorney immediately. Depending on your State, the statute of limitations (how long you have to file a claim) may be close to expiring, it is imperative that you consult with an experienced local Attorney to make sure you do not let this claim expire before filing.

You would need to file a civll lawsuit against this person. Were criminal charges ever filed against this person? If this person was criminally convicted, you would have a much better chance of prevailing in your civil suit. One thing to consider when filing a divil lawsuit, is the collectability issue. Does this person own assets or have the ability to pay for your damages, should you be award a judgment. You have a significant amount of debt. Consider seeking advise from a local bankruptcy attorney and find out what your legal rights are. Determine whether or not you would qualify for Chapter 7 bankruptcy. This would allow you to legally eliminate the debts. Definitely seek advise from a lawyer in your area.

First see a local bankruptcy lawyer who may be able to wipe out the entire debt. As to the person who put acid in your drinks, were there ever police reports filed? Even if there were and you could sue him, does he have any assets or is he judgment proof where you can't collect anything? Best of luck.
